author: Zhan Stoyanov
title: Funding Tree Planting Organisations
description: Tons of Trees are being cut everyday for human use. And only a small percentage of those are being replanted.

assessments.note: I don't understand the plan. Why don't you consult with e.g. https://www.1t.org/ and ask if they could use a $TREE token for something.
There is little to no documentation on this. Also, this is simply not a dApp that makes Cardano more competitive.
The idea at its base to fund tree planters is very noble but I think the tokenomics are out of place for this project. Its not clear on why a token needs to exist for this.
Such initiative requires a larger core team. Gather the right people, make the plan more solid and propose again, please.
This dApp is very early in ideation and nothing in this project plan includes a roadmap, budget, metrics or developer resource capable of implementing this dApp on Cardano/

Proposer mentioned they are not a developer, part of this process would be to find a team of developers and design the application. I feel like too many steps are taking place at once with this, I would suggest asking for a small amount of funds at the start and then using those funds to find a developer. The developer would then create the design (and perhaps not go with the token idea at all)

60% of the funds would go to "a small team" but it's unclear what that team would be doing. You call it "my Token". It shouldn't be your token but people's token. There might be some value in this idea but it definitely needs more thought.
This is an incomplete proposal lacking much of the documentation required to effectively address the challenge.

There are some decent details here on how funds will be spent, what is required is terms of spending to attract a community and advertise but overall the design is what is halting me from giving this an agreeable vote.

solution: Develop a Stable Income for Green Organisations through the development of a Stakable Token (NFT) from which rewards would be spread across.
experience: I don't have much experience developing a token. But i've donated and participated in Local Events related to making the world Greener.
